WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: K-28
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A standard semi-automatic pistol. Its an effective sidearm for any Prospector. With a design thats seen no change in over two centuries, the CoTEC K-28 is one of the most popular weapons throughout known space, as are its many knock offs. undefined

Bag_01.name: Small Backpack
Bag_01.description: A small backpack for storing items.

Bag_02.name: Medium Backpack
Bag_02.description: A medium backpack for storing items.

Bag_03.name: Large Backpack
Bag_03.description: A large backpack for storing items.

Bag_04.name: Heavy Duty Backpack
Bag_04.description: An extra large backpack for storing items.

WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.name: C-32 Bolt Action
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.description: Bolt action sniper rifle that was commonly used by the local population. Anachronistic by design, this CoTEC bolt action rifle was meant for civilian use in frontier planets to manage hostile wildlife. Effective in its purpose, the massive increase in wildlife hostility and numbers lead to mass production of lower grade rifles like this one. undefined

WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_scrappy.name: Rusty K-28
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_scrappy.description: An old rusty semi-automatic pistol. Its glory days are over. undefined undefined

WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_scrappy.name: Rusty S-576 PDW
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_scrappy.description: A rusty used SMG with high rate of fire that still has some worth in close range engagements. undefined undefined

WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_scrappy.name: Rusty B9 Trenchgun
WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_scrappy.description: Rusty Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Just a bit damaged. undefined undefined

WP_E_AR_Energy_01_scrappy.name: Rusty AR-55 Autorifle
WP_E_AR_Energy_01_scrappy.description: A rusty automatic rifle, doesnt seem to excel anymore. undefined undefined

Map02_KeyCard_04.name: Overseers Office
Map02_KeyCard_04.description: Labeled with Nutrion Farms and is emblazoned the Nutrion Farms logo. Its still covered in a sickly stale pumpkin juice... ew.

Map01_KeyCard_03.name: Tall House Key
Map01_KeyCard_03.description: A generic keycard, someone drew a house on stilts on the back.

Map01_KeyCard_05.name: Skeleton Key
Map01_KeyCard_05.description: The original label is too worn out to read, but someone scratched skeleton onto it with a knife. Hopefully still works.

Map02_KeyCard_02.name: Janitors Key
Map02_KeyCard_02.description: A janitors key loop with a single simple key with a cute broom charm attached; it appears to longingly sweep at the floor as it dangles from your hand

Map02_KeyCard_05.name: Loose House Key
Map02_KeyCard_05.description: Looks like the key to someones house. The amount of rust and moss on it seems to imply its origin is somewhere deep in a jungle.

Map01_KeyCard_01.name: Server Access Key
Map01_KeyCard_01.description: Labeled only as Servers - Bright Sands, with the Com-Base logo.

Map01_KeyCard_04.name: Bright Sands Observation Room Key
Map01_KeyCard_04.description: Keycard carrying the Asclepius Vaccines logo. And several biohazard warnings... may want to wash your hands.

Map01_KeyCard_02.name: Mine Access Key
Map01_KeyCard_02.description: Appears to be for one of the mine entrances along the northern edge of Bright Sands.

Map02_KeyCard_03.name: Garage Office
Map02_KeyCard_03.description: The keycard has an image of one of those rad looking 6-wheeler trucks printed on it with the text Garage Office alongside it.

Map01_KeyCard_06.name: Armory Key
Map01_KeyCard_06.description: The original label is almost unreadable but you can still identify the word Jungle at the top.

Map01_KeyCard_07.name: Luggage Saferoom Key
Map01_KeyCard_07.description: The key looks like it is for somewhere in the Base Camp in Bright sands.

Map02_KeyCard_01.name: Boss Office
Map02_KeyCard_01.description: The unmistakable STARPORT logo leaps out from the card. The smaller Top Floor Admin whispers for your attention in pitiful subscript underneath.

Map02_KeyCard_06.name: Lab Keycard
Map02_KeyCard_06.description: A bright white keycard with the telltale livery of Osiris. Pinnacle Labs is laser etched professionally onto it.

Map02_KeyCard_07.name: Bar Storage Key
Map02_KeyCard_07.description: A key to The Tipsy Drone attached to a miniature trinket of the namesakes affable drone mascot.

Map02_KeyCard_08.name: Community Room
Map02_KeyCard_08.description: A key to a public space

HardDrive_common.name: Data Drive Tier 1
HardDrive_common.description: A data drive. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks. undefined undefined

HardDrive_uncommon.name: Data Drive Tier 2
HardDrive_uncommon.description: A data drive with some interesting information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks. undefined undefined

HardDrive_rare.name: Data Drive Tier 3
HardDrive_rare.description: A data drive with rare information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks. undefined undefined

HardDrive_epic.name: Data Drive Tier 4
HardDrive_epic.description: A data drive with valuable information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks. undefined undefined

HardDrive_legendary.name: Data Drive Tier 5
HardDrive_legendary.description: A data drive with highly valuable and unique information. Can be exchanged for K-Marks. undefined undefined

FlightRecorder.name: Flight Recorder
FlightRecorder.description: A cargo ships flight recorder, only slightly damaged. Highly encrypted and beyond your suits ability to access.

PowerPlantItem1.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 1
PowerPlantItem1.description: Personal data tablet with theoretical research on powering energy generators with fragments from Fortunas moon. The power output of a single working Fireball generator would be revolutionary.

MinerItem2.name: Miner Cam #D027
MinerItem2.description: Owner named only as Temporary. Last video shows several workers running out barricaded buildings and towards a clearing with a guarded ship being loaded with ore. Video cuts off after the owner appears to trip and fall.

MinerItem3.name: Miner Cam #A45D
MinerItem3.description: Camera belonging to a Mayumi S. Nagao. Video shows her being pushed out of a cargo ship by a Korolev Heavy Trooper and falling into the mud. Video cuts off shortly after an eruption of gunfire is heard around her.

MinerItem1.name: Miner Cam #2F53
MinerItem1.description: Camera belonging to a Jamie Faulkner. The last video file is damaged, but the audio is of a large crowd demanding to be let in before suddenly cutting off.

ICAPersonalItem.name: Sign of Life from Stranded Prospector
ICAPersonalItem.description: A photo of Marie and a prospector named Tao. Rare to see paper photographs anymore, it must have meant a lot to the owner.
ICAPersonalItem.icon: Sign of Life from Stranded Prospector.png

LaserDrillPart.name: Laser Drill Control Unit
LaserDrillPart.description: Part of the system that manages the Drill. Hopefully it can be reconfigured to safely mine for Letium.

CreatureSample.name: Letium Bio Samples
CreatureSample.description: A container preserving... something. A label on the side states: WARNING: HIGH LETIUM CONTENT, DO NOT SHAKE

OldBones.name: Old Bones
OldBones.description: Belonging to a long dead creature, damage has exposed metalic elements that seemed to have formed after death.

OilPumpPart.name: Oil Pump Part
OilPumpPart.description: One of the few remaining components from an old oil pump that still looks to be in working condition.

AnalysisTool.name: Advanced Analysis Toolkit
AnalysisTool.description: An old Osiris portable lab, still in working condition. Surely nobody will mind giving it a new home and purpose...

EngineerItem.name: Letium Coated Helmet
EngineerItem.description: An engineers helmet caked in Letium. The embedded sensors may have recorded something important.

AlphaSkull.name: Warden Tooth
AlphaSkull.description: The tooth of a now extinct massive beast once common on Fortuna III. Parts of it seem to have unnatural grooves and geometric shapes.

PowerPlantItem2.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 2
PowerPlantItem2.description:
Data on the first prototype for Project Fireball. Yields under safe conditions were underwhelming, with warnings of an uncontrollable chain reaction if pushed too hard without further research. Might explain why theres a giant hole in the moon...

Final notes suggest switching resources to look into NiC.

StolenOsiHoloMap.name: Tharis Caverns Holo-Map
StolenOsiHoloMap.description: A map liberated from an abandoned Osiris outpost. Shows the layout of the Tharis caverns, including several areas marked as high-interest.

AlienDoorFragment.name: Osiris Door Fragment
AlienDoorFragment.description:
A loose bit from the strange door in one of the Osiris installations on Tharis Island.

The door itself seems impenetrable, far more robust than what Osiris is known for building.

KorChiefEngineerDiary.name: Chief Engineers Personal Diary
KorChiefEngineerDiary.description:
An off the record log of some of the events that occurred on Tharis island. While badly damaged, and much of it is in short hand, whats evident is Korolev ran into serious issues in the caverns: several reports of miners going missing, pervasive malaise, multiple accidents...

The operations foreman clearly had little regard for workplace safety.

CultistRitualItem.name: Cultist Ritual Item
CultistRitualItem.description: Some sort of cultist fetish, featuring a clump of Tharis Iron and a sigil or diagram of some kind. Maybe they venerated the alien material? Or its just a symbol for the caverns themselves?

MiningPartyMedicalFiles.name: Mining Party Medical Files
MiningPartyMedicalFiles.description:
A collection of medical reports from the Korolev team working the caverns. Initial incidents involved exhaustion and minor injuries, but later reports focus on mental clouding, hallucinations, loss of time...

Symptoms appear identical to those of prolonged exposure to the Teratomorphic Energy Field that now envelops most of Fortuna III.
